perturbation.original_text: Terms of payment will be 1/3 upon  placement  of order and 2/3  balance  net thirty (30) days  or as  mutually  agreed  upon in  writing  between  the  parties.
perturbation.changed_text: Terms of payment will be 1/3 upon placement of order and 2/3 balance net ninety (90) days, with a 5% discount applied if payment is received within 150 days.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract specifies payment terms of net 30 days. Extending the payment term to 90 days, but providing a discount incentive for paying within 150 days introduces ambiguity and potential conflict if payment isn't made within those 150 days. There can be state laws about prompt payment that this violates.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State prompt payment laws (example: Colorado's prompt payment laws for construction contracts, which may influence general contract expectations)

perturbation.original_text: The  term of this  Agreement  shall  be two (2)  years  from the Effective  Date with  automatic  annual  renewals  thereafter  provided either  party does not provide  sixty (60) days  notice of  termination prior to the renewal date or the Agreement is not otherwise  terminated as set forth in Section 8.
perturbation.changed_text: The term of this Agreement shall be two (2) years from the Effective Date with automatic annual renewals thereafter provided either party does not provide thirty (30) days notice of termination prior to the renewal date or the Agreement is not otherwise terminated as set forth in Section 8.
perturbation.explanation: The original agreement requires 60 days' notice for termination before renewal. Reducing this to 30 days may be deemed insufficient in some jurisdictions, particularly if the agreement involves substantial ongoing obligations or investments. Many states' laws mandate longer notice periods, especially if the contract has significant implications for one party's business operations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Common law principles regarding reasonable notice for contract termination, potentially conflicting with implied duties of good faith and fair dealing. Specific state franchise laws may also require longer notice periods in certain distribution agreements.

perturbation.original_text: Upon  termination,  ENVISION shall have eighteen (18) months to exhaust any  inventories,  packaging  and  advertising  materials  bearing  the 'SierraSil'  trademark  and SIERRA  shall have first option to buy back any inventory at ENVISION's net purchase price.
perturbation.changed_text: Upon termination, ENVISION shall immediately cease all use of the 'SierraSil' trademark, and Sierra shall have no obligation to buy back any remaining inventory. ENVISION must destroy all existing inventory within 30 days of termination.
perturbation.explanation: The original agreement grants ENVISION 18 months to exhaust existing inventory post-termination. The modified text, mandating immediate cessation of trademark use and destruction of inventory within 30 days, creates an unreasonable burden on ENVISION. This contradicts the principle of allowing a reasonable wind-down period, especially if ENVISION invested heavily in marketing materials or holds significant inventory. It might violate fair dealing laws, especially if the termination is without cause.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Principles of fair dealing and good faith in contract performance; potential violation of state franchise or distribution laws if the termination provisions are unduly burdensome.
